Display FCM in Viewer

Source: R/utility.R
fcm_view.Rd

Display an FCM in the Viewer pane as an interactive visNetwork object. Use the with_shiny parameter to interact with the FCM visNetwork object and store its output in the global environment via the view_fcm_visNetwork variable.

Usage

fcm_view(fcm_adj_matrix = matrix(), with_shiny = FALSE)

Arguments

fcm_adj_matrix

An adjacency matrix representing an FCM

with_shiny

View visNetwork output in a shiny app instead of the viewer pane. This adds the functionality to store node locations after moving them.

Value

A display of the input FCM in the Viewer pane; if with_shiny = TRUE, the visNetwork object saved into the global environment as fcm_view_visNetwork

See also

Other utility: check_if_local_machine_has_access_to_parallel_processing_functionalities(), check_if_local_machine_has_access_to_show_progress_functionalities(), get_adj_matrices_input_type(), get_edgelist_from_adj_matrix(), get_inferences(), get_node_IDs_from_input(), standardize_adj_matrices()

Examples


adj_matrix <- sample_fcms$simple_fcms$conventional_fcms[[1]]
fcm_view(fcm_adj_matrix = adj_matrix)



adj_matrix <- sample_fcms$simple_fcms$ivfn_fcms[[1]]
fcm_view(fcm_adj_matrix = adj_matrix)



adj_matrix <- sample_fcms$simple_fcms$tfn_fcms[[1]]
fcm_view(fcm_adj_matrix = adj_matrix)
